title: 'I'm emigrating and will rent out my house. Do I need to pay capital gains tax when I sell it?'
text:
Every week, the Telegraph’s Property Doctors bring expertise on renovations and DIY, interiors, buying and selling, lettings, legal issues and taxes – addressing three topics. Send your questions to propertydoctors@telegraph.co.uk

Taxes

Q My wife and I will be emigrating within the next two years. If we were to rent our house out, which we bought in 1993, while living abroad, would there be any capital gains tax (CGT) implications if we decided to sell it a few years later?

JS, by email
